definition: elevated stage on which martial competitions or duels were held/arena/ring
beat/to grind
to beat (a drum)
Taiwan (abbr.)
platform/stage/terrace/stand/support/station/broadcasting station/classifier for vehicles or machines
single-elimination open tournament (the winner stays on until he is himself defeated)
(old) to fight on the leitai/(fig.) to enter a contest

sentences.english: One day during the migration in the street, suddenly heard someone make open challenges to fights.
sentences.chinese: 李世民一日在街上游走，忽然聽到有人在擺擂臺。

sentences.english: How is this year's Sino-Japan Chess Challenge Tournament going on?
sentences.chinese: 今年的中日圍棋擂臺賽進行得如何？

sentences.english: On the spot to challenge and stone I dare a field of half.
sentences.chinese: 當場跳到擂臺上與石敢當進行了一場決半。

sentences.english: A rewarded emulation problem has remained unsolved for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 一個有獎擂臺問題一直沒有解決。

sentences.english: The traditional Chinese opera competition begins today with the initial special competition of Qingyi.
sentences.chinese: 戲曲擂臺賽今日開擂，首場比賽是青衣專場。

sentences.english: Today, our KB students will have a bilingual rhymes contest. Now please enjoy our wonderful rhymes.
sentences.chinese: 今天我們中班小朋友將舉行一場雙語兒歌擂臺賽。

sentences.english: Be the new king of the ring!
sentences.chinese: 誰會成爲新的擂臺之王？

sentences.english: I see crowds of people, walking round in a ring.
sentences.chinese: 我看見成羣的人，在擂臺上一圈一圈地閒逛。

sentences.english: The Buddhist monk arranged a boxing match between the child and an experienced boxer.
sentences.chinese: 僧人安排孩子和一位有經驗的拳擊手進行擂臺賽。

sentences.english: True, Hong Kong has enjoyed its own counterpart of the Speakers' Corner for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 是的，類似演說角落形式的“擂臺”，香港早已有之。

sentences.english: Fishing and bathing can be indulged in there.
sentences.chinese: 他參加了一個釣魚擂臺賽。

sentences.english: In picture one, the Lantern Festival is defeated by St. Valentine's Day on an arena.
sentences.chinese: 在圖一中，元宵節在擂臺上被情人節打敗了。

definition: to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)
to glare at
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to move quickly/to vault/flying tackle
Shuangqia suburban district of Chongqing municipality, formerly in Sichuan
hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
to fight/to exchange blows
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to go to a meeting
to mediate/to broker a compromise
rank/level
